text:
This section shows students how they can use their past work or their classmate's work to synthesize their learning. Students can access shared work, either from other students or from you, and incorporate them into their documents.

Editing and updating the Learning Log is a particularly powerful way for students to reflect on their learning. Learning Log files are visible in each problem of the Unit. Encourage students to take notes on the Unit content and incorporate it into their Learning Logs.

Accessing Class and Personal Documents

So far, you have been only using the Problem tab on the left side of the screen. Now try using the two remaining tabs to access saved personal documents or class documents while editing another document on the right side of the screen. Explore the tabs to find a document and click the thumbnail for the document. It will appear on the left. If you have a document on the right, you can drag tiles into it just as you would from the Problems tab. The files are sorted by the tabs:

  • My Work holds your present workspace and any extra documents you may have created.
  • Class Work holds all published work from your teacher or from other students.

Under My Work you also have access to sub-tabs:

  • Workspaces contain your present workspace document and any extra workspace that you may have created.
  • Learning Logs are documents that you can access throughout the Unit. They are designed for you to take notes and reflect on your learning over time. Your own Learning Logs are located under My Work and Learning Logs shared from other students in your class are under Class Work.
  • Bookmark documents are documents that you have highlighted as important and want to find easily. You can highlight any document by clicking on the light orange stripe on the documentâ€™s thumbnail icon.

If you open one of your own files on the left, there is an Edit button at the top right of the document. Clicking this will bring it to the right side for you to work on.

Under Class Work you have access to all the documents created by the students in your class. This can be many documents, so this tab gives you a way to sort these documents to make it easier to find what your are looking for. You can sort the documents by:

  • Group number
  • Student name
  • Student strategy (what method of reasoning was used to solve the problem)
  • Bookmarked files
  • Tool use (what tools--graphs, tables, number lines, etc.) were used to solve the problem)

If a thumbnail is clicked, the file opens and tiles in the document can be copied to you workspace.
